actions.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.subcommittee: Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources

official_title: A joint resolution designating the beach at 53 degrees 53'51"N, 166 degrees 34'15"W to 53 degrees 53'48"N, 166 degrees 34'21" W on Hog Island, which lies in the Northeast bay of Unalaska, Alaska be named "Arkansas Beach" in commemoration of the 206th regiment of the National Guard who served during the Japanese attack of Dutch Harbor, Unalaska on June 3 and 4, 1942.

summary.text: Names the beach on Hog Island, Unalaska, Alaska, the Arkansas Beach in commemoration of the 206th Coast Artillery Regiment and for the men who served and died during the air attacks on Dutch Harbor, Unalaska, on June 3 and 4, 1942.

titles.title: A joint resolution designating the beach at 53 degrees 53'51"N, 166 degrees 34'15"W to 53 degrees 53'48"N, 166 degrees 34'21" W on Hog Island, which lies in the Northeast bay of Unalaska, Alaska be named "Arkansas Beach" in commemoration of the 206th regiment of the National Guard who served during the Japanese attack of Dutch Harbor, Unalaska on June 3 and 4, 1942.
